Time constraints: Employees may have busy schedules and limited time to participate in fitness activities, especially if they have to attend meetings, workshops, or other work-related commitments.
Lack of motivation or interest: Some employees might not be interested in fitness or might lack the motivation to participate in the program, resulting in low participation rates.

Health concerns: Some employees might have pre-existing health conditions or physical limitations that prevent them from engaging in certain fitness activities, making it difficult for them to participate in the program.
Insufficient resources: The office might not have the necessary resources, such as equipment or qualified instructors, to support the fitness program effectively.
Resistance to change: Some employees might be resistant to changing their sedentary lifestyle and might not be willing to participate in the fitness program.
